headline: 'This is the Republican Party': NBC reporter says Ohio results show GOP's shift toward MAGA extremism
author: Sarah K. Burris
sentences: He's the Republican nominee to replace [Sen.] Rob Portman, who, we should note, the retiring Republican, the candidate he endorsed, Jane Timken, walked away with just 6 percent.
After the Jan. 6 insurrection, political commentators debated the extent to which the Republican Party had been taken over by the far-right extremist wing of their party.
The same sentiment came from Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA), who tweeted that she has been hard at work to remake the GOP in her image and that J.D.
Former Republican Rep. Joe Walsh (IL) has been critical of the shift of his party, and he called it an "authoritarian embracing cult" in 2021.
After Vance was declared the winner Tuesday, Walsh tweeted that the GOP had officially been taken over by Donald Trump.
